page.title: 18LOCAL ISSUES: EDUCATION.
page.content: The local issue which caused the most public interest in June 1985 concerned the future of the William Farr Comprehensive School. Due to falling pupil rolls and Central Government spending cut-backs the Lincolnshire Education Committee has formed a 'Task Group' which is visiting all schools in the County to gather infomation and allow local people to make suggestions for the future of Education within their local areas. These suggestions will then be made into a report which will be put before the Council for action. For this purpose, the William Farr School and Cherry Willingham School were looked at together - this created fears that the two schools were to be joined in some way either by 'Federation' or a split site school; both deemed to be unsatisfactory.
